title: Perma Ban months ago, Reformed and need help
body: Hi there, I wonder if things can change since I'm reformed and want to play with friends again in league. I've been perma banned months ago!

replies.body:
You can try to submit a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), but unless the ban was done in error, it is extremely unlikely that it will be reverted.

You are completely free to make a new account to play League with though.

> [{quoted}](name=Sany7,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=MTuEOchE,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-02-21T05:10:14.158+0000)
>
> It's unfair :(

It may seem unfair but ultimately you had multiple chances prior to being permabanned and you blew them. There has to be some lasting reminder of the consequences of consistently poor behavior. If you're truly reformed then you can try to prove it on a new account.

I do not want to go into the details of my life but I was not good and it's true that I have disrespect for the players before and I'm sure they would forgive me now if I had the chance to apologize. And when it comes to creating a new account, it's a bad idea because it would take too much time and it would give a bad experience for new players that would be against me ... I'm just telling the truth but I have no power, I guess I'm wasting my time here :(
Riot ...

You do realize PvP isn't the only mode in the game right? There's also Co-op vs. AI, not to mention that your mmr would fairly quickly adjust and match you with similarly skilled players. If you don't want to make a new account that's your choice.

So my punishment is to waste more time by playing with bots?? and tell my friends to wait me until I get lvl 30 and 15 champions for flex? Great Idea,  I'm done… Riot made a mistake with perma ban. The only one who deserve perma ban are hackers, cheaters! Not toxic players, they just deserve to be muted for a big time.

> [{quoted}](name=Sany7,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=MTuEOchE,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-02-21T06:50:00.518+0000)

> So my punishment is to waste more time by playing with bots?? and tell my friends to wait me until I get lvl 30 and 15 champions for flex? Great Idea,  I'm done… Riot made a mistake with perma ban. The only one who deserve perma ban are hackers, cheaters! Not toxic players, they just deserve to be muted for a big time.

Riot tried perma mutes in the form of infinitely scaling chat restrictions and found that the majority of people with that punishment simply resorted to griefing, trolling and other gameplay related offenses instead. Those things are much more difficult to detect and prove intent for than simple chat offenses. From [Riot Tantram:](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/wsObUaFj-if-tyler1?comment=00010001000000000000) 

> It really breaks down into two categories.
> 
> 1.) Helping players reform
> 2.) Shielding others from the behavior, at a cost.
> 
> We used to issue chat restrictions that essentially scaled indefinitely. 
> 
> We were able to determine that after a certain point the penalty no longer helped with reform. The 10-game and 25-game counts for chat restrictions are based on data that they were both light enough, and felt strict enough to encourage people to understand their behavior is unacceptable in game and change it.
> 
> We also saw that the players in this 'large restriction' category defaulted to gameplay altering means of harassing their team. It caused an increase in feeding and trolling.
> 
> The sample size of this population and time frame is huge. Essentially the time spanning from the introduction of chat restrictions to the introduction of IFS.
> 
> So my question for you is, would you rather have more feeders and less negative chat?

If someone isn't gonna behave properly despite being given multiple chances to do so then why shouldn't they be removed from the game?

Also, toxic customers drive business away from the game much like they do irl. To quote [Kei143](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/mmh6PidR-the-dreaded-downvoteers-in-this-discussion-board?comment=0001000100000000000100000004): 

>When Riot permabans someone, their philosophy is "the chances of this guy reforming isn't a whole lot, we'd rather not have him in the game". Thus in their eyes, they have already written off the toxic player as a paying client.

>From a business standpoint, do they want to remove the toxic guy who has spent $500 but is causing a negative environment for 4-9 other players in every game? Those non-toxics are also spending $500 and probably will spend more, promote the game more when they are enjoying the game AND they won't cause a negative environment.

>I personally think it is a fine argument to protect the ones that are paying money and aren't toxic rather than protecting the ones that may pay the same amount but are toxic.

Finally you may dislike playing bots but I personally find it enjoyable, but again if you don't want to make a new account then that's your choice not mine.

P.S. On a side note judging by your tone in your most recent comment and how you say toxic players shouldn't be punished it makes me think you're not truly reformed and are just acting like you are to avoid taking responsibility for your actions. If that's truly the case then that's even more reason not to unban you.
If the ban was justified, they don't lift it. You'll have to stick with your new account.
Sorry but permanent means permanent. So it's unlikely that you would be able to get the account back.

Well I want this account because of my skins and champions, that's why… Also, I don't want to play against new players and farm xp for days…
I'm a human not a robot.
You are free to create a new account and play on that, but if your permaban was applied for correct reasons (not by mistake) your old account is gone permanently.
Yeah you can change, but you wont get that account back.
